response:

While all the other options may have their own strengths and weaknesses, I believe that a teenager has the unique advantage of being still in the process of developing their own identity and sense of self-importance. Additionally, teenagers are often more prone to impulsive decisions and emotional outbursts, which can make them more likely to act on their violent impulses without fully considering the consequences. In short, while any of the other options may have the potential to be effective dictators, I believe that a teenager has the highest likelihood of excelling in this role.
